dict.string: Fixed a bug that would cause the wrong app to show up if it had a similar bundle ID.
Have the handle automatically nub after a certain amount of time!
With left handed mode enabled, on iOS 13, the keyboard would be reversed, which is bad for so many reasons... Like good luck typing on that!
Fixed a dark mode/light mode bug which affected pre iOS 13 users, causing the light mode to be grey.
On iOS 13, you can now decide whether or not you would like the fullscreen keyboard, or for it to remain in the PullOver view.
Added a new feature which makes the PullOver handle avoid the keyboard if they are overlapping.
Though landscape is not officially supported, if you have orientation lock on and are using a forced landscape application, it will display the PullOver application in portrait.
The activity indicator will now hide once hosting is completed.
@akusio_RR shared some info which helped with iOS 13 support! They have been added to the credits in the settings. Make sure you give them a follow!
I added a toggle for haptic feedback, for users who were not interested in using it.
Added an activity indicator, so you know it's trying to do something.
Fixed a bug where the keyboard would not return to its respective owner's context, causing it to not work correctly.
Fixed a bug where if you re-open the PullOver window right after closing it would fail to re-host.
With left handed mode enabled, on iOS 13, the keyboard would be reversed, which is bad for so many reasons... Like good luck typing on that!
This is the new change log, which works independently of package manager. This is where I'll tell you what I did in this version!
If you minimize the PullOver handle (by swipping it offscreen with gusto!), it'll remember that after a respring and remain nubbed
In addition to the grabber/handle supporting dark mode, the rest of the tweak does now, including the content view.
